intro: Elaterium biflorum, commonly known as the two-flower elaterium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly aromatic scent. Elaterium biflorum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
